sage.scene

Class SceneNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Group, Leaf

    public abstract class SceneNode
extends java.lang.Object
    SceneNode is the abstract parent class for all nodes in the application (game) scene graph. Scene graphs are normally built out of SceneNode subclasses: they are either Groups or subclasses of abstract subclass Leaf.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SceneNode.CULL_MODE
      CULL_MODE defines the manner in which a renderer will handle culling for a given SceneNode.
      static class  SceneNode.RENDER_MODE
      RENDER_MODE defines the render mode queue associated with a given SceneNode object when it is passed to an IRenderer for drawing.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected SceneNode.CULL_MODE cullMode
      The culling mode of this SceneNode, which defines how this SceneNode is to be handled during culling operations.
      protected BoundingVolume worldBound
      The BoundingVolume of this SceneNode, given in world coordinates.

    • Field Detail

      • cullMode

        protected SceneNode.CULL_MODE cullMode
        The culling mode of this SceneNode, which defines how this SceneNode is to be handled during culling operations.

      • worldBound

        protected BoundingVolume worldBound
        The BoundingVolume of this SceneNode, given in world coordinates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SceneNode

        public SceneNode()
        Constructs a SceneNode with default values. The default values include

        • a default name
        • Identity transforms for both local and world translations, rotations, and scales
        • a null parent node link
        • an empty array of Controllers
        • a cull-mode of SceneNode.CULL_MODE.DYNAMIC
        • a render-mode of SceneNode.RENDER_MODE.OPAQUE
        • a show-bound value of false
        • a physicsObject reference which is null
        • an empty list of RenderStates
        .

      • SceneNode

        public SceneNode(java.lang.String name)
        Constructs a SceneNode with the specified name and other parameters as defined by constructor SceneNode().
        Parameters:
        name - - the name assigned to this SceneNode

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this SceneNode.
        Returns:
        a String containing the SceneNode's name

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String nodename)
        Assigns a new name to this SceneNode.
        Parameters:
        nodename - - the new SceneNode name

      • getParent

        public SceneNode getParent()
        Returns a reference to the parent of this SceneNode. Note that the parent of a SceneNode may be null.
        Returns:
        - a reference to this SceneNode's parent SceneNode

      • setParent

        public void setParent(SceneNode parent)
        Assigns a new parent to this SceneNode. Note that care must be taken when assigning a new parent as this operation overwrites the current parent reference, potentially resulting in orphaned scenegraph branches.
        Parameters:
        parent - - a reference to the SceneNode which is to become this SceneNode's parent

      • getLocalTranslation

        public graphicslib3D.Matrix3D getLocalTranslation()
        Returns a reference to this SceneNode's local translation transform. Note that a reference is returned, not a copy (clone). Any modification to the returned object modifies this node's local transformation.
        Returns:
        The current local translation for this SceneNode

        public void setLocalTranslation(graphicslib3D.Matrix3D localTranslation)
        Sets the local translation of this node to the specified transformation.
        Parameters:

        public graphicslib3D.Matrix3D getWorldTransform()

        Returns:
        a single Matrix3D containing this node's world transforms

        Sets the SceneNode.CULL_MODE for this SceneNode.
        Parameters:
        cullMode - - the new CULL_MODE for this SceneNode

      • updateGeometricState

        public void updateGeometricState(double time,
                                 boolean isInitiator)
        Updates the transforms in this SceneNode, as well as updating the world bound of the SceneNode so that culling can utilize the node's BoundingVolume.
        Parameters:
        time - - the elapsed time, used to control the updates to be applied
        isInitiator - - a flag indicating whether the invocation to this method is from an outside source (true) or due to a recursive call while walking the scene graph (false)

      • updateTransforms

        protected void updateTransforms(double time)
        Updates the local and world transformation data for this SceneNode, including invoking any attached controllers to modify the node and then updating the node's world transform.
        Parameters:
        time - - the elapsed time, used to control the updates to be applied
        See Also:
        Group.updateTransforms(double)

      • updateWorldTransforms

        protected void updateWorldTransforms()
        Stores a new set of world transforms (translation, rotation, and scaling) for this node, generated by concatenating the parent's world transforms with this node's local transforms. If the parent is null, or if any of the parent's world transform are null, copies this node's local transforms into its world transforms.

      • propagateBoundToRoot

        public void propagateBoundToRoot()
        Walks recursively up the scenegraph tree, forcing ancestor SceneNodes to update their world bounds. Note that this method should only be called after this node's world bound has been properly updated via a call to updateGeometricState(double, boolean).

      • updateRenderStates

        public void updateRenderStates()
        Updates the RenderState values of this SceneNode and any children it has. This method should be called by the game application whenever any scenegraph RenderStates change.

      • updateRenderStates

        protected void updateRenderStates(java.util.Stack<RenderState>[] parentStates)
        Updates the RenderStates of this SceneNode. The provided array of stacks contains parent render states. This method is only intended to be called internally, not by client (game) code.
        Parameters:
        parentStates - The list of parent renderstates.

      • applyRenderStatesToSceneNode

        protected abstract void applyRenderStatesToSceneNode(java.util.Stack<RenderState>[] states)
        Called during updateRenderStates(), this function determines how the render states are actually applied to the SceneNode and any children it may have. This abstract method must be implemented by concrete SceneNode subclasses.
        Parameters:
        states - An array of stacks, one stack for each type of RenderState

      • getControllers

        public java.util.Iterator<Controller> getControllers()
        Returns an Iterator over the set of Controllers currently attached to this SceneNode.
        Returns:
        an iterator over the currently attached controllers.

      • addController

        public void addController(Controller contr)
        Adds the specified Controller to the set of Controllers currently attached to this node. Note that controllers do not actually affect a node unless they are enabled (active).
        Parameters:
        contr - The controller to be added to the SceneNode.

      • removeController

        public Controller removeController(Controller contr)
        Removes the specified Controller from the list of controllers currently attached to this SceneNode.
        Parameters:
        contr - The controller to be removed
        Returns:
        Null if the specified Controller was not attached to node; otherwise returns a reference to the removed Controller.

      • getWorldBound

        public BoundingVolume getWorldBound()
        Returns the Bounding Volume in world space for this SceneNode.
        Returns:
        the current world bounding volume for this SceneNode

      • setLocalBound

        public abstract void setLocalBound(BoundingVolume bv)
        Sets the local bounding volume for this node to the specified BV. This method is intended to be implemented directly by LEAF nodes, and in Group nodes by recursively telling the Group's children to set their local bound.
        Parameters:
        bv - The new local bounding volume for this node.

      • updateLocalBound

        public abstract void updateLocalBound()
        Causes this node to update (recompute) its local bounding volume. In Leaf nodes this is done by re-examining the vertices defining the Leaf; in Groups this is done by recursively telling child nodes to update their local bounding volume.

      • updateWorldBound

        public abstract void updateWorldBound()
        Causes this node to update its world bounding volume. In Leaf nodes this is done by multiplying the node's local bounding volume by the node's world transforms; in Group nodes this is done by computing the "merge" of the world bounding volumes of all child nodes and assigning that BV as the Group's world bound.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(IRenderer r)
        Draws this SceneNode using the specified IRenderer.
        Parameters:
        r - - the IRenderer to be used to do the drawing

      • getPhysicsObject

        public IPhysicsObject getPhysicsObject()

      • setPhysicsObject

        public void setPhysicsObject(IPhysicsObject physicsObject)

      • setShowBound

        public void setShowBound(boolean onOff)
        Enables/disables the flag in this SceneNode which indicates whether the BoundingVolume of this SceneNode should be renderered when the SceneNode is drawn. Subclasses are responsible for checking the value of this flag and drawing the bounding volume.
        Parameters:
        onOff - Whether the bounding volume for this SceneNode should be displayed when the SceneNode is drawn

      • isShowBound

        public boolean isShowBound()
        Returns the current value of the flag indicating whether the BoundingVolume of this SceneNode should be drawn.
        Returns:
        the current value of the showBound flag

      • getIsTransformSpaceParent

        public boolean getIsTransformSpaceParent()
        Returns the current value of the flag indicating whether the transform space of this SceneNode is relative to it's parent SceneNode.
        Returns:
        The current value of the tsParent flag.

      • setIsTransformSpaceParent

        public void setIsTransformSpaceParent(boolean value)
        Sets the value of the flag indicating whether the transform space of this SceneNode is relative to it's parent SceneNode. Setting this flag to true allows for hierarchical objects to be created in the scene.
        Parameters:
        value - Whether to transform this SceneNode relative to it's parent's transforms.

      • getRenderState

        public RenderState getRenderState(RenderState.RenderStateType type)
        Returns the requested RenderState that this SceneNode currently has set, or null if none is set.
        Parameters:
        type - - the RenderState.RenderStateType to return
        Returns:
        a RenderState that matches the given RenderState.RenderStateType or null

      • getRenderStates

        public RenderState[] getRenderStates()
        Returns an array containing the RenderStates current set in this SceneNode.
        Returns:
        The current RenderStates array

      • setRenderState

        public RenderState setRenderState(RenderState rs)
        setRenderState attaches a RenderState object to this SceneNode. Each SceneNode can have at most one RenderState object for each distinct RenderState.RenderStateType. Implementations of IRenderer are responsible for applying the RenderState objects attached to each SceneNode when drawing the SceneNode.

        If this SceneNode already has a RenderState object of the type of the specified RenderState, the new RenderState replaces the old one and the old one is returned.

        Parameters:
        rs - - the render state to add.
        Returns:
        - the old RenderState, or null if the incoming RenderState is null or if there was no RenderState of the incoming type already attached to the SceneNode.

      • clearRenderState

        public void clearRenderState(RenderState.RenderStateType type)
        Removes the RenderState of the specified RenderState.RenderStateType attached to this SceneNode, if any, by setting it to null.
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of RenderState to clear

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
